MANIFEST

# PyInstaller

#  before PyInstaller builds the exe, so as to inject date/other infos into it.
*.manifest
*.spec

# Installer logs
pip-log.txt
pip-delete-this-directory.txt

htmlcov/
.tox/
.nox/
.coverage
.coverage.*
.cache
nosetests.xml
coverage.xml
*.cover

# Translations
*.mo
*.pot

*.log

instance/

.scrapy

conf.json
files.tests/tests_tasks.py:
"""
Celery tests file
"""

import unittest


class TestTasks(unittest.TestCase):
    """Tests class"""

    def test_false(self):
        """
        example test (failed at every runtime)
        """
        self.assertTrue(False)
files.{name}/celery.py:
"""
Celery base file
"""

import json

from celery import Celery

# Load config file
CONFIG_FILENAME = 'conf.json'
with open(CONFIG_FILENAME, 'r') as file:
    CONFIG = json.load(file)

# check config file
if 'amqp' not in CONFIG \n        or 'celery' not in CONFIG \n        or 'host' not in CONFIG['amqp'] \n        or 'port' not in CONFIG['amqp'] \n        or 'user' not in CONFIG['amqp'] \n        or 'password' not in CONFIG['amqp'] \n        or 'default_exchange' not in CONFIG['amqp'] \n        or 'vhost' not in CONFIG['amqp'] \n        or 'app_name' not in CONFIG['celery'] \n        or 'backend' not in CONFIG['celery'] \n        or 'broker_transport_options' not in CONFIG['celery']:
    exit('configuration file not conform - {filename}'.format(filename=CONFIG_FILENAME))

# celery broker url
CELERY_BROKER = "amqp://{user}:{password}@{host}:{port}{vhost}".format(
    user=CONFIG["amqp"]['user'],
    password=CONFIG["amqp"]['password'],
    host=CONFIG["amqp"]['host'],
    port=CONFIG["amqp"]['port'],
    vhost=CONFIG["amqp"]['vhost']
)

# celery app
APP = Celery(
    CONFIG['celery']['app_name'],
    backend=CONFIG['celery']['backend'],
    broker=CELERY_BROKER,
    inclide=[]
)
APP.config_from_object(CONFIG['celery'])


@APP.task(bind=True)
def debug(self):
    print('Request: {request}'.format(request=self.request))
